description: Gender and Politics Programme in Southern Caucasus Georgia and Armenia

subproject.description:
This will be achieved through the state bodies, and the development of implementing mechanisms for proactive promotion and monitoring of gender equality and the advancement of women.
1. Develop capacities of Gender institutions at central and grass root levels
- Organize number of meetings for the support and  implementation of NAP along with the  state Policy and review of legislation
- Conduct series of regional training through Imereti Gender Resource Centre for the public representatives, civil society, business sector etc on skills development to effectively address local needs
2. Enhance gender mainstreaming in state structures, specific ministries and administrations- Establish and increase capacity of  Gender Responsive Budget Working Groups for gender analysis of policies and programmes
- Prepare and publish statistical booklet Women and Men in Georgia
- Organize training for representatives of statistics department and other relevant bodies on new methodologies and  tools related to gender disaggregated statistics
3. Increase participation of women in elections and political processes
- Organize meetings with Council and experts to review new election code through gender lenses and provide ammendments if any
- Conduct trainings for  voters/civil society  on gender equality and new election code to support women's participation in elections
- Organize trainings  for political parties and possible candidates
- Conduct regular meetings with  political Party to raise awareness on gender 
- Conduct pre - election analytical surevy and post-election assessment on women’s participation in elections
4. Increase Public Awareness on Gender Equality Issues
- Developing and implementing Public Relation strategy for raising public awareness on gender issues and women's political participation
- Organizing training sessions for media representatives on gender issues
- Identifying best gender related articles through special competition for journalists
-  Preparing and broadcasting TV & Radio Programs, Talk Shows and other promotional materials including Public Services Announcements which promote gender equality, women's participation and voter education during parliamentary elections on regular basis;
- Organizing special competitions, special events including Gender week,  roundtable meetings, exhibitions, award ceremonies, other PR campaigns
- Conducting surveys and studies on topical issues relating to gender equality and women’s participation in politics
